question: There is a terrestrial planet without atmosphere which the maximum surface temperature is mainly governed by three factors: (1) incoming radiation from its star, (2) albedo or reflectance of the planet, and (3) its rotation. Among the following statements, which one is correct?

choices.label: Planet's maximum temperature will be lower if the planet rapidly rotates around its axis.
Planet's maximum temperature will be higher if the planet rapidly rotates around its axis.
If the planet has high reflectivity, then the maximum temperature will be higher.
If the planet has low albedo, then the maximum temperature will be lower.
High stellar radiation melts the ice polar cap and chill the planet.
